task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 308°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full building façade and roofline to estimate height, so I'll tilt the camera up while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointing north and upward rather than toward the northwest target building, so I should rotate left to re-acquire the building at ~308° while keeping pitch up.
To estimate height I need both the base and roofline in one view, so I'll step back/left slightly to widen the perspective without changing orientation.
After moving, my heading is now southwest, so I should rotate right to face the target building again around 308°.
I overshot the rotation and am now facing east, so I need to rotate left to return to the northwest (~308°) view of the building.
To face the target building at ~308° from 225°, I should rotate right about 83°.
I’m still facing east, so I should rotate left to align to the northwest target direction (~308°).
The target direction 308° is available as a rightward rotation from my current 218° view, so I'll rotate right to face it directly.
I need to directly face 308°, so I'll set a custom yaw rotation from 90° to 308° (i.e., -142°).
From 218° the target 308° is exactly 90° to the right, so rotating right 90° will face the building.
The heading keeps snapping back to 90° after rotations, so I should use the provided discrete 'look back' to get to 270° then adjust to 308°.
From 180° I can rotate right to 270° and then fine-tune to 308° to face the target building.
I need a stable way to face northwest; using the 'look back' option will set heading to 270°, closer to 308°.
To get toward the target 308° from 180°, I should rotate right to 270° first.
I should use the explicit 'look back' rotation to set the view to 270°, then I can rotate a bit right to 308°.
The rotations are not yielding the intended heading changes; instead I'll stop rotating and move to a new node to regain a clear view and then reorient.
